casebody.data:
William Bates III et al. v. Hugh Whittle

House, O. J., Shapiro, Loiselle, MacDonald and Bogdanski, Js.

Argued November 7 decided November 14, 1973 Francis Carling, for the appellant (defendant). John T. Cummiskey, Jr., for the appellees (named plaintiff et al.). Per Curiam.

The question on this appeal involves issues of fact, and the judgment was a result reasonably reached on a permissible view of the evidence. Anderson v. D’Addario, 158 Conn. 616, 262 A.2d 187.

There is no error.
